intro: Guatteria macrophylla, commonly known as the large-leaf guatteria, is a species of flowering plant in the family Lauraceae. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, where it typically grows in humid, lowland forests. The plant is characterized by its large, broad leaves and fragrant, small white flowers that bloom in clusters. Its fruit is a dark purple drupe, containing a single seed, and it plays a role in the local ecosystem by providing food for various animals. Guatteria macrophylla is often found in understory layers of tropical rainforests, contributing to the biodiversity of these habitats.
